headline: Amazon stock jumps on $38 billion deal with OpenAI to use hundreds of thousands of Nvidia chips
summary: Amazon announced a multi-year $38 billion deal with OpenAI that would allow the ChatGPT developer to access hundreds of thousands of Nvidia's AI chips through its cloud computing infrastructure.

content.title: Amazon stock jumps on $38 billion deal with OpenAI to use hundreds of thousands of Nvidia chips
content.summary: Amazon announced a multi-year $38 billion deal with OpenAI that would allow the ChatGPT developer to access hundreds of thousands of Nvidia's AI chips through its cloud computing infrastructure.

headline: Guggenheim calls Oracle a 'decade stock' despite recent tumble
summary: Guggenheim says Oracle's AI build-out could define the next decade — if it can manage the spending and execution risks.

content.title: Guggenheim calls Oracle a 'decade stock' despite recent tumble

headline: Amazon Stock Hits All-Time High After OpenAI Deal
summary: Shares of Amazon closed at a new all-time high after the cloud company reached a $38 billion multi-year deal with OpenAI.  The deal, which marks the first partnership between the two companies, is still tiny compared to those OpenAI has signed with other cloud leaders, including a $300 billion deal with Oracle and a $250 billion commitment to Microsoft.  Amazon stock was up 4% Monday.

content.title: Amazon Stock Hits All-Time High After OpenAI Deal
content.summary: Shares of Amazon closed at a new all-time high after the cloud company reached a $38 billion multi-year deal with OpenAI.  The deal, which marks the first partnership between the two companies, is still tiny compared to those OpenAI has signed with other cloud leaders, including a $300 billion deal with Oracle and a $250 billion commitment to Microsoft.  Amazon stock was up 4% Monday.

headline: Amazon Stock Jumps on $38 Billion OpenAI Deal. What We Know.
summary: OpenAI and  Amazon.com  have reached a $38 billion agreement for Amazon Web Services to provide infrastructure for the ChatGPT maker’s artificial-intelligence workloads.  The partnership will begin immediately and covers the next seven years, Amazon announced Monday.  Amazon stock closed up 4% Monday.

content.title: Amazon Stock Jumps on $38 Billion OpenAI Deal. What We Know.
content.summary: OpenAI and  Amazon.com  have reached a $38 billion agreement for Amazon Web Services to provide infrastructure for the ChatGPT maker’s artificial-intelligence workloads.  The partnership will begin immediately and covers the next seven years, Amazon announced Monday.  Amazon stock closed up 4% Monday.

headline: Big AI Companies Are Reviving a Crisis-Era Tool. Wall Street Is Paying Attention.
summary: One of the many great scenes in The Big Short, which fictionalizes famed investor Michael Burry’s bet against the U.S. housing market, involves a tower of wooden blocks.  During a client pitch, a trader illustrating the risk of collateralized debt obligations unveils a Jenga tower that represents the mortgage bonds stuffed inside a CDO.  A lot of skeptical investors are waiting for a similar implosion of the artificial-intelligence investment boom.

content.title: Big AI Companies Are Reviving a Crisis-Era Tool. Wall Street Is Paying Attention.
content.summary: One of the many great scenes in The Big Short, which fictionalizes famed investor Michael Burry’s bet against the U.S. housing market, involves a tower of wooden blocks.  During a client pitch, a trader illustrating the risk of collateralized debt obligations unveils a Jenga tower that represents the mortgage bonds stuffed inside a CDO.  A lot of skeptical investors are waiting for a similar implosion of the artificial-intelligence investment boom.

headline: VetsInTech Celebrates 11th Anniversary Gala on November 7
summary: VetsInTech, the leading national non-profit organization dedicated to supporting veterans through tech-based initiatives in education, employment, and entrepreneurship, announced its 11th Annual Fall Gala, scheduled for Friday, November 7, starting at 6:00 pm PT. The in-person event will honor Veterans Day and raise funds for educational scholarships for veterans and military spouses to launch careers and companies in technology.

content.title: VetsInTech Celebrates 11th Anniversary Gala on November 7
content.summary: VetsInTech, the leading national non-profit organization dedicated to supporting veterans through tech-based initiatives in education, employment, and entrepreneurship, announced its 11th Annual Fall Gala, scheduled for Friday, November 7, starting at 6:00 pm PT. The in-person event will honor Veterans Day and raise funds for educational scholarships for veterans and military spouses to launch careers and companies in technology.

headline: OpenAI and Amazon ink $38B cloud computing deal
summary: OpenAI isn't done securing the AI infrastructure it needs to rapidly scale agentic workloads. The ChatGPT maker on Monday said it has reached a deal with Amazon to buy $38 billion in cloud computing services over the next seven years.

content.title: OpenAI and Amazon ink $38B cloud computing deal
content.summary: OpenAI isn't done securing the AI infrastructure it needs to rapidly scale agentic workloads. The ChatGPT maker on Monday said it has reached a deal with Amazon to buy $38 billion in cloud computing services over the next seven years.

headline: Google owner Alphabet to tap US dollar, euro bond markets
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Google owner Alphabet is tapping the U.S. dollar and euro debt markets in a multi-tranche senior unsecured notes offering.  The digital media and tech giant will use the proceeds from the note sale for general corporate purposes, including the potential repayment of a portion of its outstanding debt, according to a Monday report by Moody's Ratings.  Alphabet last took out fresh debt in April, tapping the euro debt market for 6.75 billion euros ($7.87 billion) for the first time.

content.title: Google owner Alphabet to tap US dollar, euro bond markets
content.summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Google owner Alphabet is tapping the U.S. dollar and euro debt markets in a multi-tranche senior unsecured notes offering.  The digital media and tech giant will use the proceeds from the note sale for general corporate purposes, including the potential repayment of a portion of its outstanding debt, according to a Monday report by Moody's Ratings.  Alphabet last took out fresh debt in April, tapping the euro debt market for 6.75 billion euros ($7.87 billion) for the first time.

headline: MongoDB taps Cloudflare executive Chirantan Desai as CEO
summary: Desai will succeed Dev Ittycheria, who is stepping down after more than 11 years leading the company.  Shares of MongoDB rose 5% following the announcement.  Desai, a veteran technology executive with over 25 years of experience, previously also held senior roles at ServiceNow, EMC, Symantec and Oracle.

content.title: MongoDB taps Cloudflare executive Chirantan Desai as CEO
content.summary: Desai will succeed Dev Ittycheria, who is stepping down after more than 11 years leading the company.  Shares of MongoDB rose 5% following the announcement.  Desai, a veteran technology executive with over 25 years of experience, previously also held senior roles at ServiceNow, EMC, Symantec and Oracle.

headline: Microsoft’s AI Efforts in the U.A.E. Get a Big Boost
summary: The tech giant said it is the first company granted an export license by the Trump administration’s Commerce Department to ship AI chips to the U.A.E.

headline: Green Investors Enjoy Huge Returns as Stock Market Powers Through Trump’s Attacks
summary: The S&P’s main gauge tracking clean energy is up about 50% this year; the MSCI World Index has gained less than 20% in the same period.  Much of that development is pegged to a near-insatiable demand for energy to power the data centers feeding artificial intelligence.  For investors, those factors have outweighed Trump’s attacks on what he often calls the “green scam.”

content.title: Green Investors Enjoy Huge Returns as Stock Market Powers Through Trump’s Attacks
content.summary: The S&P’s main gauge tracking clean energy is up about 50% this year; the MSCI World Index has gained less than 20% in the same period.  Much of that development is pegged to a near-insatiable demand for energy to power the data centers feeding artificial intelligence.  For investors, those factors have outweighed Trump’s attacks on what he often calls the “green scam.”

headline: Broadpin Wins 2025 Oracle Global Service Partner Tech/Cloud Customer Success Award
summary: Broadpin, a global Oracle consulting leader formed from the unification of Project Partners, PROMATIS, Quistor, and PITSS, has been named the Winner of the 2025 Oracle Global Service Partner Tech/Cloud Customer Success Award. The recognition was announced during the Oracle Partner Success Summit at Oracle AI World 2025 in Las Vegas, coinciding with Broadpin's official brand launch.

headline: How Broadcom’s (AVGO) Role in AI Supercomputers May Shape Its Long-Term Growth Prospects
summary: In recent days, Broadcom has drawn industry attention through its role in powering Nvidia and Oracle's newly announced supercomputer initiative for the U.S. Department of Energy, showcasing its advanced connectivity chips in high-demand AI applications. This collaboration highlights Broadcom's growing influence in AI data center infrastructure, underscoring its potential to secure long-term hardware contracts as artificial intelligence usage expands across industries. headline: Trump admin to partially fund SNAP benefits, Oracle a 'decade stock'
summary: The latest Market Minute has some of the top stories Wall Street is watching on Monday, Nov. 3. The Trump administration says it will partially fund SNAP payments following rulings from two separate federal judges. OPEC+ will increase production in December. Guggenheim is calling Oracle (ORCL) a "decade stock." Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

content.title: Trump admin to partially fund SNAP benefits, Oracle a 'decade stock'
content.description:
The latest Market Minute has some of the top stories Wall Street is watching on Monday, Nov. 3.

The Trump administration says it will partially fund SNAP payments following rulings from two separate federal judges.

OPEC+ will increase production in December.

Guggenheim is calling Oracle (ORCL) a "decade stock."

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
